intro: Chytraculia obversa, commonly known as the reverse-faced chytracul, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Chytraculaceae. It is characterized by its unique, bilaterally symmetrical leaves that exhibit a distinct reverse orientation compared to most plants in its family. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically located on the underside of its foliage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, Chytraculia obversa is considered a vulnerable species.
